title: KHREMETES
content:
KHREMETES (Chremetes) was a river-god of western Libya (modern Libya).

The only other major North African river personified by the Greeks was the Neilos (Nile).

Nonnus, Dionysiaca 13. 378 ff (trans. Rouse) (Greek epic C5th A.D.) :
        "[Krataigonos (Crataegonus) and his Libyans joined the army of Dionysos in their campaign against the
        Indians :] Their masses came led by Krataigonos, whom Ankhiroe (Anchiroe) daughter of Khremetes (Chremetes)
        brought forth on her father's riverbank in that shortlasting union with Psyllos (Psyllus) the harebrained; the
        bridegroom she held in her arms was the gods' enemy."

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
